title: The Advent of Lord Kṛṣṇa
description: The divine appearance of Lord Krishna in the mortal world to deliver the teachings and protect dharma.

title: Prayers by the Demigods for Lord Kṛṣṇa in the Womb
description: The celestial beings offer prayers and blessings for the safe birth of Lord Krishna in Devaki's womb.

title: The Birth of Lord Kṛṣṇa
description: The miraculous birth of Krishna in the prison cell of King Kamsa, heralding the beginning of His divine mission.

title: Kaṁsa Begins His Persecutions
description: King Kamsa, fearing the prophecy of his death, starts persecuting Krishna and His family.

title: Meeting of Nanda and Vasudeva
description: The touching reunion of Nanda Maharaja and Vasudeva as they unite for the safety of Krishna.

title: Pūtanā Killed
description: Krishna liberates the demoness Putana who came disguised as a mother to kill Him.

title: The Salvation of Tṛṇāvarta
description: Krishna kills the whirlwind demon Trinavarta who tries to carry Him into the sky.

title: Vision of the Universal Form
description: Krishna reveals His cosmic and universal form to His devotees, demonstrating His divine omnipresence.

title: Mother Yaśodā Binds Lord Kṛṣṇa
description: Mother Yashoda binds Krishna to a mortar after He steals butter, giving Him the name Damodara.

title: The Deliverance of Nalakūvara and Maṇigrīva
description: Krishna frees the sons of Kubera, Nalakuvara and Manigriva, cursed as twin trees.

title: Killing the Demon Vatsāsura
description: Krishna kills the calf-demon Vatsasura while grazing cows with His friends.

title: Killing the Demon Bakāsura
description: Krishna kills the crane-demon Bakasura who tried to swallow Him.

title: The Killing of the Aghāsura Demon
description: Krishna kills Aghasura, a giant serpent who tried to swallow Him and His friends.

title: The Stealing of the Boys and Calves by Brahmā
description: Lord Brahma tests Krishna by stealing the cowherd boys and calves; Krishna expands Himself to replace them.

title: Prayers Offered by Lord Brahmā to Lord Kṛṣṇa
description: Lord Brahma offers humble prayers and praises to Lord Krishna, recognizing His divine glory and protection.

title: The Killing of Dhenukāsura
description: Balarama and Krishna kill the ass-demon Dhenukasura in the Talavana forest.

title: Subduing Kaliya
description: Krishna subdues the poisonous serpent Kaliya and dances on his hoods.

title: Extinguishing the Forest Fire
description: Krishna swallows a raging forest fire to save His friends and cows.

title: Killing the Demon Pralambāsura
description: Balarama kills the demon Pralambasura who disguised himself as a cowherd boy.

title: Devouring the Forest Fire
description: Krishna consumes the raging forest fire with His divine power, saving the forest and its creatures.

title: Description of Autumn
description: A poetic depiction of the serene and beautiful autumn season in Vrindavana.

title: The Gopīs Attracted by the Flute
description: The gopis are irresistibly drawn by Krishna's enchanting flute music, expressing their deep love and devotion.

title: Stealing the Garments of the Unmarried Gopī Girls
description: Krishna playfully steals the garments of gopis to teach them complete surrender.

title: Delivering the Wives of the Brahmanas who Performed Sacrifices
description: Krishna delivers the wives of the brahmanas who performed yajnas from distress and grants them protection.

title: Worshiping Govardhana Hill
description: Krishna lifts the Govardhana Hill for 7 days to protect the Vrajavasis from Indra's wrath.

title: Devastating Rainfall in Vṛndāvana
description: Heavy rains flood Vrindavana, causing hardship, but Krishna's presence assures protection and hope.

title: Wonderful Kṛṣṇa
description: An elaborate description of Krishna’s divine qualities and miraculous pastimes enchanting all living beings.

title: Prayers by Indra, the King of Heaven
description: Indra offers prayers and respects to Krishna, acknowledging His supreme power and protection.

title: Releasing Nanda Mahārāja from the Clutches of Varuṇa
description: Krishna rescues Nanda Maharaja from the Varuna planet and reveals His divine form.

title: The Rāsa Dance: Introduction
description: Krishna dances with the gopis in the moonlit forests of Vrindavan in the divine Rasa Lila.

title: Kṛṣṇa’s Hiding from the Gopīs
description: Krishna playfully hides from the gopis, deepening their love and yearning for Him.

title: Songs by the Gopīs
description: The gopis express their ecstatic love for Krishna through heartfelt songs and prayers.

title: Description of the Rasa Dance
description: A poetic and vivid description of the divine Rasa dance, where Krishna and the gopis engage in transcendental pastimes.

title: Aristasura Vadh
description: Krishna kills the bull demon Aristasura who attacks the village.

title: Killing the Keśī Demon
description: Krishna kills the horse demon Keshi sent by Kamsa.

title: Killing the Vyomāsura Demon
description: Krishna kills the thief-demon Vyomasura who disguised himself during their games.

title: Kṛṣṇa Enters Mathurā
description: Krishna and Balarama enter Mathura and enchant the citizens with Their beauty.

title: The Breaking of the Bow in the Sacrificial Arena
description: Krishna breaks Kamsa's ceremonial bow during the Dhanur-yajna festival.

title: Killing the Wrestlers
description: Krishna and Balarama defeat Chanura and Mushtika in Kamsa’s wrestling arena.

title: The Killing of Kaṁsa
description: Krishna jumps on the throne and kills Kamsa, ending his reign of terror.

title: Delivery of the Message of Kṛṣṇa to the Gopīs
description: Krishna sends His loving message to the gopis, deepening their spiritual connection and devotion.

title: Krishna's Pastimes in Dvaraka
description: After leaving Mathura, Krishna resides in Dvaraka and performs royal pastimes.

title: Delivering the Wives of the Brahmanas who Performed Sacrifices
description: Krishna delivers the wives of the brahmanas who performed yajnas from distress and grants them protection.

title: Prayers by Indra, the King of Heaven
description: Indra offers prayers and respects to Krishna, acknowledging His supreme power and protection.

title: Vidyādhara Liberated and the Demon Śaṅkhacūḍa Killed
description: Krishna liberates the vidyadhara and kills the demon Sankhasura, showcasing His divine protection.

title: The Gopīs’ Feelings of Separation
description: The gopis express their deep feelings of separation from Krishna, revealing their intense devotional love.

title: Kaṁsa Sends Akrūra for Kṛṣṇa
description: Kamsa sends Akrura to bring Krishna to Mathura, intending to trap Him for his evil plans.

title: Akrūra’s Arrival in Vṛndāvana
description: Akrura arrives in Vrindavana, witnessing Krishna's divine pastimes and glory.

title: Akrūra’s Return Journey and His Vision of Viṣṇuloka Within the Yamunā River
description: On his return journey, Akrura visits the transcendental realm of Visnuloka within the Yamuna River, receiving divine visions.

title: Prayers by Akrūra
description: Akrura offers prayers and praises to Krishna, acknowledging His supreme divinity and blessings.

title: The Killing of the Elephant Kuvalayāpīḍa
description: Krishna defeats the ferocious elephant Kuvalayapida sent to terrorize Him, displaying His divine strength.

title: Kṛṣṇa Recovers the Son of His Teacher
description: Krishna courageously rescues the son of His guru, showcasing His compassion and valor.

title: Uddhava Visits Vṛndāvana
description: Lord Kṛṣṇa sends Uddhava to Vṛndāvana with a message for the gopīs and His family. There, Uddhava witnesses the highest form of love and devotion for Kṛṣṇa. Moved by their unparalleled bhakti, he glorifies the land of Vraja and aspires to be eternally connected with it.

title: Kṛṣṇa Pleases His Devotees
description: Krishna joyfully engages in pastimes that bring happiness and satisfaction to His devotees.

title: Ill-motivated Dhṛtarāṣṭra
description: Dhritarashtra acts with improper intentions, highlighting the contrast with Krishna’s divine will.

title: Kṛṣṇa Erects the Dvārakā Fort
description: Krishna constructs the magnificent fort of Dvaraka, establishing a secure kingdom for His devotees.

title: The Deliverance of Mucukunda
description: Krishna grants liberation to Mucukunda, freeing him from worldly bondage.

title: Kṛṣṇa, the Raṇacora
description: Krishna, known as the 'Ranchor,' manifests His divine power through various heroic feats.

title: Kṛṣṇa Kidnaps Rukmiṇī
description: Krishna rescues and marries Rukmini, overcoming obstacles and fulfilling divine destiny.

title: Kṛṣṇa Defeats All the Princes and Takes Rukmiṇī Home to Dvārakā
description: Krishna triumphs over rival princes and safely brings Rukmini to His kingdom in Dvaraka.

title: Pradyumna Born to Kṛṣṇa and Rukmiṇī
description: The birth of Pradyumna, son of Krishna and Rukmini, marking a significant event in the divine lineage.

title: The Story of the Syamantaka Jewel
description: The account of the precious Syamantaka jewel, its theft, and recovery by Krishna.

title: The Killing of Satrājit and Śatadhanvā
description: Krishna confronts and defeats Satrajit and the assassin Satadhanva in defense of justice.

title: Five Queens Married by Kṛṣṇa
description: Krishna marries five queens, establishing significant alliances and expanding His royal family.

title: The Deliverance of the Demon Bhaumāsura
description: Krishna liberates the demon Bhaumasura, showcasing His power and mercy.

title: Talks Between Kṛṣṇa and Rukmiṇī
description: Dialogues between Krishna and Rukmi revealing their differing perspectives and divine will.

title: The Genealogy of the Family of Kṛṣṇa
description: A detailed genealogy of Krishna’s family, tracing divine and royal lineages.

title: The Meeting of Ūṣā and Aniruddha
description: The romantic and dramatic encounter of Usa and Aniruddha, Krishna’s grandson.

title: Lord Kṛṣṇa Fights with Bāṇāsura
description: Krishna battles the powerful demon king Banasura to protect His devotees and uphold dharma.

title: The Story of King Nṛga
description: The tale of King Nrga, illustrating divine justice and Krishna’s guidance.

title: Lord Balarāma Visits Vṛndāvana
description: Balarama’s visit to Vrndavana, witnessing Krishna’s pastimes and reminiscing their childhood.

title: The Deliverance of Pauṇḍraka and the King of Kāśī
description: Krishna defeats Paundraka and the King of Kasi, establishing His supremacy.

title: The Deliverance of Dvivida Gorilla
description: Krishna liberates the demon Dvivida, ending his tyranny.

title: The Marriage of Sāmba
description: The auspicious marriage of Krishna’s son Samba, marking a joyous occasion.

title: The Great Sage Nārada Visits the Different Homes of Lord Kṛṣṇa
description: Narada Muni visits various homes of Lord Krishna, witnessing His divine pastimes and blessings.

title: Lord Kṛṣṇa’s Daily Activities
description: A detailed description of Krishna's routine activities and divine pastimes throughout the day.

title: Lord Kṛṣṇa in Indraprastha City
description: Krishna's presence and activities in the city of Indraprastha during the Mahabharata era.

title: The Liberation of King Jarāsandha
description: Krishna's role in the liberation and defeat of the powerful King Jarasandha.

title: Lord Kṛṣṇa Returns to the City of Hastināpura
description: Krishna's return to Hastinapura, marking significant events during the Mahabharata period.

title: The Deliverance of Śiśupāla
description: Krishna delivers Sisupala from his offenses, demonstrating divine justice and mercy.

title: Why Duryodhana Felt Insulted at the End of the Rājasūya Sacrifice
description: Analysis of the reasons behind Duryodhana's insult and anger following the Rajasuya sacrifice.

title: The Battle Between Śālva and Members of the Yadu Dynasty
description: A fierce battle unfolds between Salva and the Yadu dynasty, showcasing Krishna’s strategic prowess and protection of his clan.

title: The Deliverance of Śālva
description: Śālva, an ally of Śiśupāla, attacks Dvārakā with a flying city created by Maya Dānava to avenge his friend’s death. Lord Kṛṣṇa, with unmatched prowess, destroys the illusion and the city, finally slaying Śālva and restoring peace. This pastime shows Kṛṣṇa’s supreme mastery over both mysticism and warfare.

title: The Killing of Dantavakra, Vidūratha and Romaharṣaṇa
description: Krishna defeats the demons Dantavakra, Viduratha, and Romaharṣaṇa, protecting dharma and the devotees.

title: The Liberation of Balvala, and Lord Balarāma’s Touring the Sacred Places
description: Balvala is liberated, and Lord Balarama tours various sacred places, manifesting his divine presence.

title: The Meeting of Lord Kṛṣṇa with Sudāmā Brāhmaṇa
description: A heartwarming meeting between Lord Krishna and his childhood friend Sudama, exemplifying devotion and humility.

title: The Brāhmaṇa Sudāmā Blessed by Lord Kṛṣṇa
description: Lord Krishna blesses Sudama with divine benedictions, showing the power of friendship and devotion.

title: Lord Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma Meet the Inhabitants of Vṛndāvana
description: Lord Krishna and Balarama meet and interact with the inhabitants of Vrndavana, strengthening their divine relationships.

title: Draupadī Meets the Queens of Kṛṣṇa
description: Draupadi meets the queens of Krishna, marking a significant moment of unity and friendship.

title: Sacrificial Ceremonies Performed by Vasudeva
description: Vasudeva performs various sacrificial ceremonies, invoking divine blessings and auspiciousness.

title: Spiritual Instruction for Vasudeva, and the Return of the Six Dead Sons of Devakī by Lord Kṛṣṇa
description: Krishna imparts spiritual instruction to Vasudeva and returns the six sons of Devaki, who had passed away.

title: The Kidnapping of Subhadrā, and Lord Kṛṣṇa’s Visiting Śrutadeva and Bahulāśva
description: The story of Subhadra’s kidnapping and Krishna’s visit to Srutadeva and Bahulasva unfolds with divine intervention.

title: Prayers by the Personified Vedas
description: The Vedas, personified, offer prayers and praises to Lord Krishna for his supreme glories.

title: The Deliverance of Lord Śiva
description: Lord Shiva is delivered from distress by the grace and mercy of Lord Krishna.

title: The Superexcellent Power of Kṛṣṇa
description: A narration of Krishna’s supreme and superexcellent divine power, demonstrating his transcendence.

title: Summary Description of Lord Kṛṣṇa’s Pastimes
description: A concise summary of the glorious pastimes of Lord Krishna, encompassing his divine activities and teachings.
